title: This Scalloped Furniture Item Is the "Cutest. Find. Ever."
author: Isabel Petrou
text: DecoratingFurnitureIsabel PetrouIsabel PetrouIsabel is an incoming sophomore at the University of Vermont studying public communication. She grew up in Portsmouth, Rhode Island, where she frequented the beach often during the summer. Even though her heart belongs to the ocean, the mountains are becoming a close contender.‚Ä¶read morepublished nowWe independently select these products‚Äîif you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Photo: Alex Lepe; Props Styling: Thomas HoerupIf you live in a dorm, you know that having smart, cute storage items is crucial. The major lack of space means you need to get creative even when it comes to storing all your everyday college essentials.¬†That‚Äôs why a three-tiered rolling cart is perfect for a dorm room. I used mine in both my freshman- and sophomore-year dorms. I chose to keep my hair tools and accessories and tech gear on the bottom two levels and decorated the top tier to have a cute clock and fun (unlit) candles. Storage and decor in one!¬†You can use a rolling cart for beauty supplies, too, but it could also serve as a bedside table, a cleaning supplies cart, a craft supplies station, and so much more. It‚Äôs truly so versatile and easy to move around (especially during move-in and move-out). Once you move off campus, the usage options expand even more.If you love the idea of this item but want one that feels a bit different from the standard metal option, check out Walmart‚Äôs $65 white, blue, or natural scalloped rolling cart (currently, the white and natural are out of stock online). Technically, it‚Äôs labeled as an art cart, but it can be used for anything. Most of these carts are almost identical, but this one has some flair to it with a large scalloped design on the front top tier that adds cute character. The three-tiered, 15x22x24-inch piece also has chalkboard side panels, which can be fun for organizational labeling, holiday decor, or whatever else gets you feeling crafty.¬†Jen Alvarez (@jensgatheringnest) highlights the natural version of the cart in a Reel, writing as part of the caption, ‚ÄúCutest. Find. Ever. üíï Spotted this scalloped art cart at Walmart for under $65, and I‚Äôm obsessed!‚Äù¬†One commenter responded, ‚ÄúStop!! That cart is sooo cute.‚Äù Another commenter wrote, ‚ÄúArt cart omg this is the cutest idea. Was it hard to assemble?‚Äù Alvarez replied, ‚Äúaww thank you gorgeous! not at all! üòç‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù ¬†¬†Win, win!

Isabel is an incoming sophomore at the University of Vermont studying public communication. She grew up in Portsmouth, Rhode Island, where she frequented the beach often during the summer. Even though her heart belongs to the ocean, the mountains are becoming a close contender.‚Ä¶read more

published now

We independently select these products‚Äîif you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

If you live in a dorm, you know that having smart, cute storage items is crucial. The major lack of space means you need to get creative even when it comes to storing all your everyday college essentials.¬†

That‚Äôs why a three-tiered rolling cart is perfect for a dorm room. I used mine in both my freshman- and sophomore-year dorms. I chose to keep my hair tools and accessories and tech gear on the bottom two levels and decorated the top tier to have a cute clock and fun (unlit) candles. Storage and decor in one!¬†

You can use a rolling cart for beauty supplies, too, but it could also serve as a bedside table, a cleaning supplies cart, a craft supplies station, and so much more. It‚Äôs truly so versatile and easy to move around (especially during move-in and move-out). Once you move off campus, the usage options expand even more.

If you love the idea of this item but want one that feels a bit different from the standard metal option, check out Walmart‚Äôs $65 white, blue, or natural scalloped rolling cart (currently, the white and natural are out of stock online). Technically, it‚Äôs labeled as an art cart, but it can be used for anything. Most of these carts are almost identical, but this one has some flair to it with a large scalloped design on the front top tier that adds cute character. The three-tiered, 15x22x24-inch piece also has chalkboard side panels, which can be fun for organizational labeling, holiday decor, or whatever else gets you feeling crafty.¬†

Jen Alvarez (@jensgatheringnest) highlights the natural version of the cart in a Reel, writing as part of the caption, ‚ÄúCutest. Find. Ever. üíï Spotted this scalloped art cart at Walmart for under $65, and I‚Äôm obsessed!‚Äù¬†

One commenter responded, ‚ÄúStop!! That cart is sooo cute.‚Äù Another commenter wrote, ‚ÄúArt cart omg this is the cutest idea. Was it hard to assemble?‚Äù Alvarez replied, ‚Äúaww thank you gorgeous! not at all! üòç‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù ¬†¬†Win, win!
